channel.title: So I need a new video card
channel.description:
..And this little twat wont shut up about this particular card: http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16814130085
At the same time, another friend is pointing me to this card: http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16814130328
I know there's better, and I planned on getting better, but I don't know a whole lot about video cards. I always figured the GT series was integrated. He claims it's better based on price-to-performance.
I have $300 to waste btw.

item.title: So I need a new video card
item.dc:creator: @FastBallz FastBawlz
item.description:
@FastBallz wrote:

[quote=“xEnt, post:47, topic:233682”]8600GTS best there? i lol’d irl.

9800/8800GT >

9600GT/8600GT/8600GTS/7950

7600 is just out of the question.[/quote]

nt, but it’s:
9600GT>8600GTS>8600GT>7950

You really shouldn’t be calling other people idiots.

Read full topic
item.source: So I need a new video card

item.title: So I need a new video card
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

Cheese_Police:

get an 8800gt

I love this one, it kills crysis on max resolution at medium settings and fallout 3 looks great too.

newegg.com

EVGA GeForce 8800 GT DirectX 10 512-P3-N801-AR 512MB 256-Bit GDDR3 PCI Express...

Buy EVGA GeForce 8800 GT DirectX 10 512-P3-N801-AR 512MB 256-Bit GDDR3 PCI Express 2.0 x16 HDCP Ready SLI Support Video Card with fast shipping and top-rated customer service.Once you know, you Newegg!

This is the one I bought, thought it is out of stock.

Read full topic

item.source: So I need a new video card

item.title: So I need a new video card
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

[quote=“mrrules, post:40, topic:233682”]lolol you guys have no clue about any of these series do you…

9800 gt is horribad.

9600 gt is better then 9800 gt by a long shot…

8800 is ok but a 8600 gts is ALOT better…

8600 gts is prob best out of series.

EDIT:

7600 ok card not better then any higher ones tho…

7950 is a amazing card but the 8600 gts would do you better.

Hope some smart ass trys to say that if higher number the better it is , because that isn’t true at all especially if you have owned them all like me. And if you do say that you should go die and never get on a comp ever.[/quote]
Here is how it works:
7X00 cards were released in 2006. They support up to DX9.
8X00 cards were released in 2007. They support up to DX 10. The only one of these that is shittier than it’s 7X00 counterpart is the 8500GT.
9X00 cards were released in 2008. They support up to DX 10.1. They are slightly more powerful than their 8X00 counterpart’s. Yet, they use much more power.

Read full topic
item.source: So I need a new video card

EDIT:

7600 ok card not better then any higher ones tho…

7950 is a amazing card but the 8600 gts would do you better.

Hope some smart ass trys to say that if higher number the better it is , because that isn’t true at all especially if you have owned them all like me. And if you do say that you should go die and never get on a comp ever.[/quote]
Idiot, die now. You have no idea what you’re talking about.

8600GTS best there? i lol’d irl.

9800/8800GT >

9600GT/8600GT/8600GTS/7950

7600 is just out of the question.

Read full topic

item.title: So I need a new video card
item.dc:creator: @bigh51 bigh51
item.description:
@bigh51 wrote:

xEnt:

[quote=SomethingToHide]I’ve got a 9800GT and it outperforms the 8800GT…

Where did anyone say it didn’t? As far as i know, the 9800GT is equal to 8800GT, just renamed, restickerd, reboxed etc. :P[/quote]No, it consumes less power and is a bit more powerful.

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:17, topic:233682”]http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16814150316

That looks like the best bang for your buck. And do yourself a favor and get an Nvidia card over ATI, they have always been better and probably always will be.[/quote]ATI actually seems to be producing better cards than Nividia ATM.

exe626:

[quote author=bigh51 link=topic=308147.msg2464715#msg2464715 date=1222646411]I lol’d irl. The 8800 gt is one of the MOST powerful cards out today. I’d say it’s top 5 or 10. It’s at least 100x better than any integrated out today.

Arrogance is fun. The GT series is mediocre at best.[/quote]Yeah, it may be mediocre but it’s certainly not integrated.

Read full topic
